comments.content:
The --flagfile flags.txt option mentioned in this discussion post:

https://groups.google.com/group/closure-compiler-
discuss/browse_thread/thread/a6f969cd6c0c4bee

is no longer present in the application version of the compiler. The 
windows command line has a limit to how many characters can be put into a 
command. Being able to use a flags file would be a useful alternative to 
trying to specifying lenghty lists of externs on the command line.

If you could, please put the option back in.

--flagfile was a standard feature of the Flags class that is missing from the args4j
implementation.

I quickly hit the 10Kb command line limit and would like to see this feature implemented if anyone has the spare time - we have 140 JS source files in our project at present.

Another related thread here:
https://groups.google.com/group/closure-compiler-discuss/browse_thread/thread/557a607ec5baa7c7/dd7806af09a14049
This issue was closed by revision r717.
